publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-327# John Swinburne: Fiscal Autonomy-That the Parliament notes that a majority of Scots believe that the Scottish Parliament should have increased powers; recognises that devolution is a dynamic process and therefore calls for dialogue amongst the political parties within the Parliament with regard to securing additional powers, particularly fiscal autonomy, and further recognises that such powers would enable the Parliament to use the resources of Scotland to fully address the social and economic problems facing senior citizens and other excluded members of Scottish society.
S2M-327# Fiscal Autonomy (lodged on 9 September 2003) Margo MacDonald*
S2M-327# Fiscal Autonomy (lodged on 9 September 2003) Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Rosie Kane*, Christine Grahame*, Tricia Marwick*, Richard Lochhead*

S2M-327# John Swinburne: Fiscal Autonomyâ€”That the Parliament notes that a majority of Scots believe that the Scottish Parliament should have increased powers; recognises that devolution is a dynamic process and therefore calls for dialogue amongst the political parties within the Parliament with regard to securing additional powers, particularly fiscal autonomy, and further recognises that such powers would enable the Parliament to use the resources of Scotland to fully address the social and economic problems facing senior citizens and other excluded members of Scottish society. Supported by: Margo MacDonald, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Rosie Kane, Christine Grahame, Tricia Marwick, Richard Lochhead, Jim Mather*, Frances Curran*, Brian Adam*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Robin Harper*, Chris Ballance*, Fergus Ewing*, Shona Robison*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-327# Fiscal Autonomy (lodged on 9 September 2003) Mr Rob Gibson*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mark Ballard*
S2M-327# Fiscal Autonomy (lodged on 9 September 2003) Ms Sandra White*, Stewart Stevenson*
S2M-327# Fiscal Autonomy (lodged on 9 September 2003) Alex Neil*, Fiona Hyslop*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-327# Fiscal Autonomy (lodged on 9 September 2003) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-327# Fiscal Autonomy (lodged on 9 September 2003) Ms Rosemary Byrne*
